title: Adolescent Technology-Enhanced Mathematics Learning: Interaction Design via Instant Messaging

context.prior_knowledge: Core middle school mathematics concepts and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Most learners are proficient in smartphone and SNS use, with strong interest in improving math problem-solving skills through real-time feedback

learning_goals: Learners can explain the problem-solving process for complex math questions three or more times via asynchronous interaction with instructors through instant messaging.
Learners can propose two or more problem-solving strategies through peer discussions using collaborative tools in mobile environments.
Learners achieve 80% or higher goal attainment rates in weekly formative assessments via a digital feedback system.

resources: Educational App with Built-in Real-Time Chat Functionality

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
